sectiondef.header: DesignWare IIC Interrupt Callback Routine Select Marcos

description.para: DesignWare IIC interrupt callback routines select macros definitions

detaileddescription.para: ready to send callback
ready to receive callback
check expressions used in DesignWare IIC driver implementation
valid check of iic info object

briefdescription.para: Disable designware iic device.
Enable designware iic device.
Clear all designware iic interrupt.
test whether iic is ready to write, 1 ready, 0 not ready
test whether iic is ready to receive, 1 ready, 0 not ready
Write data into IIC TX FIFO with STOP/RESTART Condition, and R/W bit.
Read Data from IIC RX FIFO.
Enable designware iic bit interrupt with mask.
Disable designware iic bit interrupt with mask.
Get TX FIFO Length.
Get RX FIFO Length.
Set designware iic transfer in 7bit of 10bit addressing mode as a master.
Set designware iic transfer in 7bit of 10bit addressing mode as a slave.
Set designware iic transfer target address for addressing any iic slave device as a master.

detaileddescription.para: Set designware iic transfer target address for addressing any iic slave device as a master

briefdescription.para: Set designware iic slave address as a slave.
Select speed mode, and return proper speed mode configuration.
Set designware iic speed mode.
Set designware working mode as master or slave.
Set IC_CLK frequency by configuration the *CNT registers for different speed modes.
Set spike suppression configuration.

memberdef.argsstring: (DW_IIC_CTRL *iic_ctrl_ptr, uint32_t speed_mode, uint32_t addr_mode, uint32_t tar_addr)
memberdef.name: dw_iic_master_init

detaileddescription.para: Init Designware IIC Device into Master mode
Init Designware IIC Device into Slave mode
Check error for IIC master device
Check error for IIC slave device
enable designware iic
disable designware iic
Disable iic master interrupt for transmit or receive
Disable iic slave interrupt for transmit or receive
Enable iic master interrupt for transmit or receive
Enable iic slave interrupt for transmit or receive

briefdescription.para: disable designware iic send or receive interrupt

parameterdescription.para: control code of callback routine of send or receive

briefdescription.para: Enable DesignWare IIC send or receive interrupt.
Enable designware iic interrupt.
Disable designware iic interrupt.

inbodydescription.para: disable iic send&receive interrupt after disable iic interrupt

detaileddescription.para: abort current interrupt transmit transfer
abort current interrupt receive transfer
Get available transmit fifo count
Get available receive fifo count
IIC Master device transmit 1 data, next_cond can be IC_DATA_CMD_STOP, IC_DATA_CMD_RESTART and ref IC_DATA_CMD_NONE
IIC Slave device transmit 1 data
IIC Master device receive 1 data, next_cond can be IC_DATA_CMD_STOP, IC_DATA_CMD_RESTART and IC_DATA_CMD_NONE
IIC Slave device receive 1 data
IIC Master transmit called in interrupt
IIC Master receive called in interrupt
IIC Slave transmit called in interrupt

briefdescription.para: Open a designware iic device.

parameterdescription.para: When mode is DEV_MASTER_MODE, param stands for speed mode, when mode is DEV_SLAVE_MODE, param stands for slave device 7bit address
If device was opened before with different parameters, then just increase the opn_cnt and return E_OPNED
Device is opened for different mode before, if you want to open it with different mode, you need to fully close it first.

briefdescription.para: Close a DesignWare IIC device.

parameterdescription.para: Close successfully without any issues(including secenary that device is already closed)
Device is still opened, the device opn_cnt decreased by 1

briefdescription.para: Control iic by ctrl command.

parameterdescription.para: control command, to change or get some thing related to iic
Parameters that maybe argument of the command, or return values of the command, must not be NULL
Device object is not valid or not exists
Parameter is not valid for current control command
Control device failed, due to hardware issues, such as device is disabled
Control device failed, due to different reasons like in transfer state
Control command is not supported or not valid

inbodydescription.para: When device is disabled, only IIC_CMD_ENA_DEV, IIC_CMD_DIS_DEV, IIC_CMD_GET_STATUS, IIC_CMD_RESET are available, other commands will return E_SYS

briefdescription.para: Poll transmit data through DesignWare IIC as master or slave.

parameterdescription.para: Data to send (data must be uint8_t type)
0 Byte count that was successfully sent for poll method, it might can't send that much due to different error state.
Device object is not valid or not exists
Device is still in transfer state
Can't write data to hardware due to hardware issues, such as device is disabled

briefdescription.para: Read data through DesignWare IIC.

parameterdescription.para: Data that need to read (data must be uint8_t type)
0 Byte count that was successfully received for poll method, it might can't send that much due to different error state.
Device object is not valid or not exists
Device is still in transfer state
Can't receive data from hardware due to hardware issues, such as device is disabled

briefdescription.para: DesignWare IIC interrupt processing handler.
